title: Authorized Access Control
description: Limit system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, and devices (including other systems).
plain_language: Only allow approved people, programs, and devices to access your systems.
why_it_matters: Unauthorized access can lead to data breaches, system compromise, and loss of sensitive information.

title: Transaction & Function Control
description: Limit system access to the types of transactions and functions that authorized users are permitted to execute.
plain_language: Restrict what actions users can perform based on their role.
why_it_matters: Limits potential damage from compromised accounts and enforces separation of duties.

title: CUI Flow Enforcement
description: Control the flow of CUI in accordance with approved authorizations.
plain_language: Manage how sensitive information moves within and between systems.
why_it_matters: Prevents unauthorized disclosure of CUI through uncontrolled data flows.

title: Separation of Duties
description: Separate the duties of individuals to reduce the risk of malevolent activity without collusion.
plain_language: Divide responsibilities so no single person has complete control over critical functions.
why_it_matters: Reduces risk of fraud and errors by requiring multiple people for sensitive operations.

title: Least Privilege
description: Employ the principle of least privilege, including for specific security functions and privileged accounts.
plain_language: Give users only the minimum access they need to do their jobs.
why_it_matters: Limits blast radius of compromised accounts and reduces attack surface.

title: Non-privileged Account Use
description: Use non-privileged accounts or roles when accessing nonsecurity functions.
plain_language: Use regular accounts for everyday tasks, not admin accounts.
why_it_matters: Reduces exposure of privileged credentials to potential compromise.

title: Privileged Functions
description: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions and capture the execution of such functions in audit logs.
plain_language: Block regular users from admin functions and log all privileged actions.
why_it_matters: Maintains separation of privileges and provides accountability for admin actions.

title: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts
description: Limit unsuccessful logon attempts.
plain_language: Lock accounts after too many failed login attempts.
why_it_matters: Prevents brute force password attacks and unauthorized access attempts.

title: Privacy & Security Notices
description: Provide privacy and security notices consistent with applicable CUI rules.
plain_language: Display security warnings and privacy notices before users log in.
why_it_matters: Establishes legal basis for monitoring and informs users of their responsibilities.

title: Session Lock
description: Use session lock with pattern-hiding displays to prevent access and viewing of data after a period of inactivity.
plain_language: Automatically lock screens after periods of inactivity.
why_it_matters: Protects unattended workstations from unauthorized access.

title: Session Termination
description: Terminate (automatically) a user session after a defined condition.
plain_language: Automatically end user sessions after set periods of inactivity.
why_it_matters: Reduces window of opportunity for session hijacking and unauthorized access.

title: Control Remote Access
description: Monitor and control remote access sessions.
plain_language: Track and manage all remote connections to your systems.
why_it_matters: Remote access is a common attack vector; monitoring helps detect threats.

title: Remote Access Confidentiality
description: Employ cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality of remote access sessions.
plain_language: Encrypt all remote access connections.
why_it_matters: Prevents eavesdropping on remote sessions containing sensitive information.

title: Remote Access Routing
description: Route remote access via managed access control points.
plain_language: Force all remote connections through controlled entry points like VPNs.
why_it_matters: Centralizes monitoring and control of remote access for better security.

title: Privileged Remote Access
description: Authorize remote execution of privileged commands and remote access to security-relevant information.
plain_language: Require special authorization for admin functions performed remotely.
why_it_matters: Adds extra protection for the most sensitive remote operations.

title: Wireless Access Authorization
description: Authorize wireless access prior to allowing such connections.
plain_language: Require approval before devices can connect via WiFi.
why_it_matters: Prevents unauthorized devices from accessing your network wirelessly.

title: Wireless Access Protection
description: Protect wireless access using authentication and encryption.
plain_language: Secure WiFi with strong passwords and encryption.
why_it_matters: Wireless networks are easily accessible and need strong protection.

title: Mobile Device Connection
description: Control connection of mobile devices.
plain_language: Manage which mobile devices can connect to your systems.
why_it_matters: Mobile devices can be lost or stolen, creating security risks.

title: Encrypt CUI on Mobile
description: Encrypt CUI on mobile devices and mobile computing platforms.
plain_language: Encrypt sensitive data on laptops, phones, and tablets.
why_it_matters: Protects data if mobile devices are lost or stolen.

title: External Connections
description: Verify and control/limit connections to and use of external systems.
plain_language: Control and monitor connections to outside systems.
why_it_matters: External systems may have different security levels and pose risks.

title: Portable Storage Use
description: Limit use of portable storage devices on external systems.
plain_language: Restrict use of USB drives and similar devices.
why_it_matters: Portable storage can be used to steal data or introduce malware.

title: Publicly Accessible Content
description: Control information posted or processed on publicly accessible systems.
plain_language: Review content before posting publicly to prevent CUI exposure.
why_it_matters: Prevents accidental disclosure of sensitive information.

title: Security Awareness
description: Ensure that managers, systems administrators, and users of organizational systems are made aware of the security risks associated with their activities and of the applicable policies, standards, and procedures related to the security of those systems.
plain_language: Train everyone about security risks and policies.
why_it_matters: Informed users are the first line of defense against threats.

title: Role-Based Training
description: Ensure that personnel are trained to carry out their assigned information security-related duties and responsibilities.
plain_language: Provide security training specific to each person's role.
why_it_matters: Role-specific training ensures people can protect what they work with.

title: Insider Threat Awareness
description: Provide security awareness training on recognizing and reporting potential indicators of insider threat.
plain_language: Train staff to recognize and report suspicious insider behavior.
why_it_matters: Insider threats are particularly dangerous because they have authorized access.

title: System Auditing
description: Create and retain system audit logs and records to the extent needed to enable the monitoring, analysis, investigation, and reporting of unlawful or unauthorized system activity.
plain_language: Keep logs of system activity for security monitoring.
why_it_matters: Logs are essential for detecting and investigating security incidents.

title: Audit Content
description: Ensure that the actions of individual system users can be uniquely traced to those users so they can be held accountable for their actions.
plain_language: Make sure logs show who did what.
why_it_matters: Individual accountability deters malicious behavior and aids investigations.

title: Audit Review
description: Review and update logged events.
plain_language: Regularly review logs and update what events are tracked.
why_it_matters: Active review ensures logs remain useful and detect new threats.

title: Audit Failure Alerting
description: Alert in the event of an audit logging process failure.
plain_language: Get notified if logging stops working.
why_it_matters: Logging failures could hide malicious activity.

title: Audit Correlation
description: Correlate audit record review, analysis, and reporting processes for investigation and response to indications of unlawful, unauthorized, suspicious, or unusual activity.
plain_language: Connect log analysis to incident investigation.
why_it_matters: Correlation helps identify complex attacks across multiple systems.

title: Audit Reduction
description: Provide audit record reduction and report generation to support on-demand analysis and reporting.
plain_language: Provide tools to filter and analyze logs.
why_it_matters: Raw logs are overwhelming; tools help find relevant information quickly.

title: Authoritative Time Source
description: Provide a system capability that compares and synchronizes internal system clocks with an authoritative source to generate time stamps for audit records.
plain_language: Sync system clocks for accurate log timestamps.
why_it_matters: Accurate timestamps are essential for correlating events during investigations.

title: Audit Protection
description: Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.
plain_language: Protect logs from tampering.
why_it_matters: Attackers often try to delete or modify logs to cover their tracks.

title: Audit Management
description: Limit management of audit logging functionality to a subset of privileged users.
plain_language: Only allow certain admins to manage logging settings.
why_it_matters: Restricts who can disable or modify audit controls.

title: Baseline Configuration
description: Establish and maintain baseline configurations and inventories of organizational systems (including hardware, software, firmware, and documentation) throughout the respective system development life cycles.
plain_language: Document standard configurations for all systems.
why_it_matters: Baselines help detect unauthorized changes and ensure consistency.

title: Security Configuration Settings
description: Establish and enforce security configuration settings for information technology products employed in organizational systems.
plain_language: Configure systems securely and maintain those settings.
why_it_matters: Secure configurations reduce vulnerabilities attackers can exploit.

title: System Change Management
description: Track, review, approve, or disapprove, and log changes to organizational systems.
plain_language: Control and document all system changes.
why_it_matters: Change management prevents unauthorized or harmful changes.

title: Impact Analysis
description: Analyze the security impact of changes prior to implementation.
plain_language: Assess security impact before making changes.
why_it_matters: Prevents changes from introducing new vulnerabilities.

title: Access Restrictions for Change
description: Define, document, approve, and enforce physical and logical access restrictions associated with changes to organizational systems.
plain_language: Control who can make system changes.
why_it_matters: Restricting change access prevents unauthorized modifications.

title: Least Functionality
description: Employ the principle of least functionality by configuring organizational systems to provide only essential capabilities.
plain_language: Disable unnecessary features and services.
why_it_matters: Reduces attack surface by eliminating unneeded functionality.

title: Nonessential Functionality
description: Restrict, disable, or prevent the use of nonessential programs, functions, ports, protocols, and services.
plain_language: Turn off what you don't need.
why_it_matters: Each unused service is a potential entry point for attackers.

title: Application Execution Policy
description: Apply deny-by-exception (blocklisting) policy to prevent the use of unauthorized software or deny-all, permit-by-exception (allowlisting) policy to allow the execution of authorized software.
plain_language: Control which software can run on systems.
why_it_matters: Prevents malware and unauthorized software from executing.

title: User-Installed Software
description: Control and monitor user-installed software.
plain_language: Manage what software users can install.
why_it_matters: Uncontrolled software can introduce vulnerabilities or malware.

title: Identification
description: Identify system users, processes acting on behalf of users, and devices.
plain_language: Identify who and what is accessing your systems.
why_it_matters: You can't control access if you can't identify who's accessing.

title: Authentication
description: Authenticate (or verify) the identities of users, processes, or devices, as a prerequisite to allowing access to organizational systems.
plain_language: Verify identities before granting access.
why_it_matters: Authentication ensures only legitimate users gain access.

title: Multifactor Authentication
description: Use multifactor authentication for local and network access to privileged accounts and for network access to non-privileged accounts.
plain_language: Require multiple forms of verification for login.
why_it_matters: MFA dramatically reduces risk of compromised credentials.

title: Replay Resistant Authentication
description: Employ replay-resistant authentication mechanisms for network access to privileged and non-privileged accounts.
plain_language: Use authentication that can't be replayed by attackers.
why_it_matters: Prevents captured authentication data from being reused.

title: Identifier Management
description: Prevent reuse of identifiers for a defined period.
plain_language: Don't reuse user IDs after people leave.
why_it_matters: Prevents confusion and potential unauthorized access from ID reuse.

title: Password Change
description: Disable identifiers after a defined period of inactivity.
plain_language: Disable unused accounts.
why_it_matters: Inactive accounts are targets for attackers.

title: Password Complexity
description: Enforce a minimum password complexity and change of characters when new passwords are created.
plain_language: Require strong passwords.
why_it_matters: Complex passwords are harder to guess or crack.

title: Password Reuse
description: Prohibit password reuse for a specified number of generations.
plain_language: Don't allow users to reuse old passwords.
why_it_matters: Password reuse reduces the effectiveness of password changes.

title: Temporary Passwords
description: Allow temporary password use for system logons with an immediate change to a permanent password.
plain_language: Force password change on first login with temporary passwords.
why_it_matters: Ensures users set their own secure passwords.

title: Cryptographic Password Storage
description: Store and transmit only cryptographically-protected passwords.
plain_language: Never store passwords in plain text.
why_it_matters: Protects passwords even if storage is compromised.

title: Obscure Feedback
description: Obscure feedback of authentication information.
plain_language: Hide passwords when typed.
why_it_matters: Prevents shoulder surfing and screen capture of passwords.

title: Incident Handling
description: Establish an operational incident-handling capability for organizational systems that includes preparation, detection, analysis, containment, recovery, and user response activities.
plain_language: Have a plan for handling security incidents.
why_it_matters: Proper incident response minimizes damage and recovery time.

title: Incident Reporting
description: Track, document, and report incidents to designated officials and/or authorities both internal and external to the organization.
plain_language: Report security incidents properly.
why_it_matters: Proper reporting enables coordinated response and compliance.

title: Incident Response Testing
description: Test the organizational incident response capability.
plain_language: Practice your incident response plan.
why_it_matters: Testing reveals gaps before a real incident occurs.

title: System Maintenance
description: Perform maintenance on organizational systems.
plain_language: Regularly maintain and update systems.
why_it_matters: Maintenance keeps systems secure and operational.

title: Maintenance Tools
description: Provide controls on the tools, techniques, mechanisms, and personnel used to conduct system maintenance.
plain_language: Control maintenance tools and who uses them.
why_it_matters: Maintenance tools can be used to compromise systems.

title: Offsite Maintenance
description: Ensure equipment removed for off-site maintenance is sanitized of any CUI.
plain_language: Remove sensitive data before sending equipment for repair.
why_it_matters: Prevents data exposure during off-site maintenance.

title: Media Inspection
description: Check media containing diagnostic and test programs for malicious code before the media are used in organizational systems.
plain_language: Scan maintenance media for malware.
why_it_matters: Maintenance media could introduce malware.

title: Nonlocal Maintenance
description: Require multifactor authentication to establish nonlocal maintenance sessions via external network connections and terminate such connections when nonlocal maintenance is complete.
plain_language: Secure remote maintenance sessions with MFA.
why_it_matters: Remote maintenance is a potential attack vector.

title: Maintenance Personnel
description: Supervise the maintenance activities of personnel without required access authorization.
plain_language: Supervise maintenance workers who lack security clearance.
why_it_matters: Unsupervised maintenance could lead to compromise.

title: Media Protection
description: Protect (i.e., physically control and securely store) system media containing CUI, both paper and digital.
plain_language: Physically protect media containing sensitive information.
why_it_matters: Unprotected media can be stolen or copied.

title: Media Access
description: Limit access to CUI on system media to authorized users.
plain_language: Control who can access media with sensitive data.
why_it_matters: Limits exposure of CUI to authorized personnel only.

title: Media Sanitization
description: Sanitize or destroy system media containing CUI before disposal or release for reuse.
plain_language: Securely wipe or destroy media before disposal.
why_it_matters: Improper disposal can expose sensitive data.

title: Media Marking
description: Mark media with necessary CUI markings and distribution limitations.
plain_language: Label media containing CUI appropriately.
why_it_matters: Proper markings ensure appropriate handling.

title: Media Transport
description: Control access to media containing CUI and maintain accountability for media during transport outside of controlled areas.
plain_language: Track media during transport.
why_it_matters: Media can be lost or stolen during transport.

title: Portable Storage Encryption
description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality of CUI stored on digital media during transport unless otherwise protected by alternative physical safeguards.
plain_language: Encrypt portable storage devices.
why_it_matters: Encryption protects data if devices are lost.

title: Removable Media
description: Control the use of removable media on system components.
plain_language: Manage use of USB drives and similar devices.
why_it_matters: Removable media can introduce malware or steal data.

title: Shared Media
description: Prohibit the use of portable storage devices when such devices have no identifiable owner.
plain_language: Don't allow unknown USB devices.
why_it_matters: Unknown devices could contain malware.

title: CUI Backup Protection
description: Protect the confidentiality of backup CUI at storage locations.
plain_language: Encrypt and protect backup data.
why_it_matters: Backups contain the same sensitive data as primary systems.

title: Personnel Screening
description: Screen individuals prior to authorizing access to organizational systems containing CUI.
plain_language: Perform background checks before granting access.
why_it_matters: Screening helps identify potential insider threats.

title: Personnel Actions
description: Ensure that organizational systems containing CUI are protected during and after personnel actions such as terminations and transfers.
plain_language: Revoke access when employees leave or change roles.
why_it_matters: Former employees shouldn't retain access to systems.

title: Limit Physical Access
description: Limit physical access to organizational systems, equipment, and the respective operating environments to authorized individuals.
plain_language: Control physical access to systems.
why_it_matters: Physical access can bypass logical security controls.

title: Protect Physical Facility
description: Protect and monitor the physical facility and support infrastructure for organizational systems.
plain_language: Secure and monitor your facilities.
why_it_matters: Facility compromises can affect all systems within.

title: Escort Visitors
description: Escort visitors and monitor visitor activity.
plain_language: Don't let visitors wander unescorted.
why_it_matters: Unescorted visitors could access sensitive areas.

title: Physical Access Logs
description: Maintain audit logs of physical access.
plain_language: Log who enters secure areas.
why_it_matters: Logs help investigate physical security incidents.

title: Access to Output Devices
description: Control and manage physical access devices.
plain_language: Secure printers and other output devices.
why_it_matters: Output devices can expose sensitive documents.

title: Alternative Work Sites
description: Enforce safeguarding measures for CUI at alternate work sites.
plain_language: Protect CUI when working remotely.
why_it_matters: Remote work locations may lack physical security.

title: Risk Assessment
description: Periodically assess the risk to organizational operations (including mission, functions, image, or reputation), organizational assets, and individuals, resulting from the operation of organizational systems and the associated processing, storage, or transmission of CUI.
plain_language: Regularly assess your security risks.
why_it_matters: Risk assessments identify where to focus security efforts.

title: Vulnerability Scanning
description: Scan for vulnerabilities in organizational systems and applications periodically and when new vulnerabilities affecting those systems and applications are identified.
plain_language: Regularly scan for security weaknesses.
why_it_matters: Vulnerability scanning finds weaknesses before attackers do.

title: Vulnerability Remediation
description: Remediate vulnerabilities in accordance with risk assessments.
plain_language: Fix vulnerabilities based on risk priority.
why_it_matters: Unpatched vulnerabilities are common attack targets.

title: Security Assessment
description: Periodically assess the security controls in organizational systems to determine if the controls are effective in their application.
plain_language: Regularly check if your security controls work.
why_it_matters: Controls may degrade over time or become ineffective.

title: Plan of Action
description: Develop and implement plans of action designed to correct deficiencies and reduce or eliminate vulnerabilities in organizational systems.
plain_language: Create and follow plans to fix security issues.
why_it_matters: POAMs ensure vulnerabilities get addressed.

title: Continuous Monitoring
description: Monitor security controls on an ongoing basis to ensure the continued effectiveness of the controls.
plain_language: Continuously monitor your security controls.
why_it_matters: Threats evolve; monitoring detects when controls fail.

title: System Security Plan
description: Develop, document, and periodically update system security plans that describe system boundaries, system environments of operation, how security requirements are implemented, and the relationships with or connections to other systems.
plain_language: Document your security plan.
why_it_matters: Documentation ensures everyone understands security implementation.

title: Boundary Protection
description: Monitor, control, and protect communications (i.e., information transmitted or received by organizational systems) at the external boundaries and key internal boundaries of organizational systems.
plain_language: Protect network boundaries with firewalls and monitoring.
why_it_matters: Boundaries are where attacks enter your environment.

title: Security Engineering
description: Employ architectural designs, software development techniques, and systems engineering principles that promote effective information security within organizational systems.
plain_language: Build security into system design.
why_it_matters: Security by design is more effective than bolted-on security.

title: Role Separation
description: Separate user functionality from system management functionality.
plain_language: Keep user and admin functions separate.
why_it_matters: Separation limits damage from compromised accounts.

title: Shared Resource Control
description: Prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources.
plain_language: Control information leakage through shared resources.
why_it_matters: Shared resources can leak data between users.

title: Public Access Protections
description: Implement subnetworks for publicly accessible system components that are physically or logically separated from internal networks.
plain_language: Separate public-facing systems from internal networks.
why_it_matters: Limits exposure if public systems are compromised.

title: Network Communication by Exception
description: Deny network communications traffic by default and allow network communications traffic by exception.
plain_language: Block all traffic except what's explicitly allowed.
why_it_matters: Deny-by-default provides stronger protection.

title: Split Tunneling
description: Prevent remote devices from simultaneously establishing non-remote connections with organizational systems and communicating via some other connection to resources in external networks (i.e., split tunneling).
plain_language: Prevent split tunneling for remote workers.
why_it_matters: Split tunneling can bypass network security controls.

title: CUI Encryption
description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure of CUI during transmission unless otherwise protected by alternative physical safeguards.
plain_language: Encrypt CUI in transit.
why_it_matters: Encryption prevents interception of sensitive data.

title: Connection Termination
description: Terminate network connections associated with communications sessions at the end of the sessions or after a defined period of inactivity.
plain_language: End idle network connections.
why_it_matters: Idle connections can be hijacked.

title: Cryptographic Key Management
description: Establish and manage cryptographic keys for required cryptography employed in organizational systems.
plain_language: Manage encryption keys properly.
why_it_matters: Poor key management undermines encryption.

title: FIPS Cryptography
description: Employ FIPS-validated cryptography when used to protect the confidentiality of CUI.
plain_language: Use FIPS-validated encryption.
why_it_matters: FIPS validation ensures cryptographic strength.

title: Collaborative Computing
description: Prohibit remote activation of collaborative computing devices and provide indication of devices in use to users present at the device.
plain_language: Control remote activation of cameras and mics.
why_it_matters: Prevents unauthorized surveillance.

title: Flaw Remediation
description: Identify, report, and correct system flaws in a timely manner.
plain_language: Fix security flaws promptly.
why_it_matters: Unpatched flaws are easy targets for attackers.

title: Malicious Code Protection
description: Provide protection from malicious code at designated locations within organizational systems.
plain_language: Deploy antivirus and antimalware protection.
why_it_matters: Malware is a primary attack vector.

title: Security Alerts
description: Monitor system security alerts and advisories and take action in response.
plain_language: Act on security alerts promptly.
why_it_matters: Timely response prevents exploitation of new vulnerabilities.

title: Update Malicious Code Protection
description: Update malicious code protection mechanisms when new releases are available.
plain_language: Keep antivirus definitions current.
why_it_matters: New malware appears constantly; protection must stay updated.

title: System Scanning
description: Perform periodic scans of organizational systems and real-time scans of files from external sources as files are downloaded, opened, or executed.
plain_language: Scan systems and files for malware.
why_it_matters: Scanning detects malware before it causes damage.

title: Monitor Communications
description: Monitor organizational systems, including inbound and outbound communications traffic, to detect attacks and indicators of potential attacks.
plain_language: Monitor network traffic for attacks.
why_it_matters: Traffic monitoring detects attacks in progress.

title: Identify Unauthorized Use
description: Identify unauthorized use of organizational systems.
plain_language: Detect unauthorized system use.
why_it_matters: Detecting unauthorized use helps catch breaches early.
